title: From Metal, to KPop, to Hip Hop. Props to everyone who worked each band skin
body:
Every band released, they always blow it out of the park. I know people have different tastes, and each band is not for everyone, but can we give a huge amazing props to the the Production team, music team and design team for creative amazing skins and music. It’s actually so diverse, seeing types of genres being explored so actually well. 

True Damage for me hit the hip hop genre on the spot. From the rap flows, to rhythm drops and lyrics, the band and singers nailed everything to the style.

I would not compare K/DA and True Damage or Pentakill because they’re both different styles and would not be fair. 

I’m happy they’re moving to this direction with music. Songs like Awkaen and Phoenix should also give a huge shoutout to them too. I’m excited for what next in the future of music in league, and now other games too.

replies.body: Thank you so much for the kind words! True Damage was my first music skins project. I was the narrative writer and wrote Ekko's in game voice lines, so seeing your appreciation means so much to me {{sticker:sg-soraka}}

> [{quoted}](name=SkiptoMyLuo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KojoMhFy,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2019-11-11T20:26:47.082+0000)
>
> Thank you so much for the kind words! True Damage was my first music skins project. I was the narrative writer and wrote Ekko's in game voice lines, so seeing your appreciation means so much to me {{sticker:sg-soraka}}

Awww! Congrats on the project!

> [{quoted}](name=SkiptoMyLuo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KojoMhFy,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2019-11-11T20:26:47.082+0000)
>
> Thank you so much for the kind words! True Damage was my first music skins project. I was the narrative writer and wrote Ekko's in game voice lines, so seeing your appreciation means so much to me {{sticker:sg-soraka}}

**POGGERS**.

You dun gud, Mike, you dun gud.

TD Ekko is absolutely *amazing*. Love the skin, love his raps, love how his IRL cosplay turned out. (Kadu=Out is THE MAN.)

These bands are why Mundo's CEO. The music business is brutal. 







Still want a Zillionaire Zilean skin though....
Zilean IS getting a skin soon.....
I wish they'd update pentakills skins to the level of the other two music groups since it's the only group with champions who don't get any skin love (did akali really need two music skins?)

I'm looking forwards to these animated bands more than I do each years worlds.

Fantastic job

Yeah, each group has made something special. 

Though you can compare Akali on both of these past music groups, since her part is done by Soyeon of G-Idol. I think it was more impactful in the K/DA song since she had a bigger presence in that song, which is unfortunate for True Damage.

True Damage itself though is pretty nice. Really enjoyed the different animation style they always go with for each of these as well. From CGI to a more traditional looking style. It's always a fun surprise to see where that can take the songs as well.

Seeing Metal, pop and now more hip-hop/rap it makes me wonder where the next music group might take us.

> [{quoted}](name=Sukishoo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KojoMhFy,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-11-10T18:05:23.093+0000)
>
> Yeah, each group has made something special. 
> 
> Though you can compare Akali on both of these past music groups, since her part is done by Soyeon of G-Idol. I think it was more impactful in the K/DA song since she had a bigger presence in that song, which is unfortunate for True Damage.
> 
> True Damage itself though is pretty nice. Really enjoyed the different animation style they always go with for each of these as well. From CGI to a more traditional looking style. It's always a fun surprise to see where that can take the songs as well.
> 
> Seeing Metal, pop and now more hip-hop/rap it makes me wonder where the next music group might take us.

For True Damage, Akali isn’t the lead rapper. She’s just collabing with them. She isn’t supposed to take the spotlight like K/DA cause she’s the lead rapper there. Here she wants the others to shine. Both Duckwrth and Thutmoose killed their verse for Ekko and Keke and Becky G nailed their parts too.

Well I guess that's true about Akali.  

I'm still kind of sad that they had Duckwrth and Thutmoose do the vocals for Ekko.  There were 5 champions in this afterall, so I dunno why they have two of them voice one. I mean they sound pretty similar, so it worked out pretty well as they sounded great but why not get someone else and then they could have opened up some vocals for Yasuo? Or something.

Keke and Becky G were great for Senna and Qiyana.  Really love Keke on Senna.

> [{quoted}](name=Sukishoo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KojoMhFy,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-10T23:26:48.066+0000)

If you ever watch videos where they mention the "DJ" or "Producer" and he's in the video, unless they're DJ Khaled, they usually say nothing other than that self-promotion insert to let you know they made the beat.

Like how every DJ Khaled song goes, "DJ Khaled! We the best!"

He doesn't usually sing. He just...makes the beat.  Yasuo made the beat. He contributed the most to the song. Yeah, Ekko had two parts, but if Ekko was stripped out, we still have the hook and two people that did verses. And guess what, we still have the beat.  Keep Ekko and get rid of Yasuo, they'll be doing acapella, and rapping without a beat or any background.

> [{quoted}](name=Sukishoo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KojoMhFy,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-10T23:26:48.066+0000)
>
> Well I guess that's true about Akali.  
> 
> I'm still kind of sad that they had Duckwrth and Thutmoose do the vocals for Ekko.  There were 5 champions in this afterall, so I dunno why they have two of them voice one. I mean they sound pretty similar, so it worked out pretty well as they sounded great but why not get someone else and then they could have opened up some vocals for Yasuo? Or something.
> 
> Keke and Becky G were great for Senna and Qiyana.  Really love Keke on Senna.

Its supposed to represent Ekko’s ult, how he has that clone that follow him. He’s the one supposed to be rapping. How that part was slow and rewinded everything back in the music video.

But yeah I agree I wish yas had a part in it. NF would’ve been a great choice for Yasuo if they wanted lines.

> [{quoted}](name=Sukishoo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KojoMhFy,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-11-10T18:05:23.093+0000)
>
> Yeah, each group has made something special. 
> 
> Though you can compare Akali on both of these past music groups, since her part is done by Soyeon of G-Idol. I think it was more impactful in the K/DA song since she had a bigger presence in that song, which is unfortunate for True Damage.
> 
> True Damage itself though is pretty nice. Really enjoyed the different animation style they always go with for each of these as well. From CGI to a more traditional looking style. It's always a fun surprise to see where that can take the songs as well.
> 
> Seeing Metal, pop and now more hip-hop/rap it makes me wonder where the next music group might take us.

Beautiful instrumental music!

Kai'sa gets her own classy dance group. Kai'sa, Irelia, Leona, Diana. Team DIVine Emotion--DIVE!
I loved all of it.
I hope that they are doing a punk rock project next, with {{champion:222}} as the lead singer.

None of the music skin lines are really my thing, but it's undeniable that Riot puts a lot of effort in to these skin lines. I'd even use skins like Pentakill Karthus and Kayle, and True Damage Ekko and Senna, because they're good despite the fact that they're a part of those skin lines.

I only wish other skin lines got this much love. I think things like Praetorian could have been so much better than they are if Riot maybe gave them things to tie in to all the other robotic skin lines, for instance.

Tear of the Goddess and The Lightbringer are still, Absolutely, THE best tracks Riot has put out. 

Outside if skinlines Legends Never Die is unbeatable though, but that's largely thanks to Against the Current's vocalist. Major props to Riot for introducing a well deserving group to myself and *MILLIONS* of others. Still wish they'd get BLACKPINK though.
You forgot DJ Sona... :( She brought some epic EDM and technically we can go ahead and put the whole warsongs album under her belt too
Still waiting for a Zed skin referencing Zedd.

2013 worlds opener is still the best musically :)

The orchestra was gorgeous, Crystal Method's ambience was heavenly, NiN's drummer added a solid groove, and Wes Borland's appearance was epic. Then when they all got blended in together at the ending of the song for the climax.... man good times.

Can we finish Emumu now?
Please?

I thought TD sucked.

incoherent lip sync garbage song
